thread.title: DRCongo airline aims to overhaul air transport
thread.title_full: DRCongo airline aims to overhaul air transport | News24

author: news24.com
title: DRCongo airline aims to overhaul air transport
text:
Kinshasa - A new airline was launched in the Democratic Republic of Congo on Friday in a bid to revolutionise air transport within the vast country where flights are currently operated only by the UN and small carriers blacklisted by the EU.
Two Airbus jets belonging to Congo Airways left the capital Kinshasa's Ndjili international airport after a ceremony attended by President Joseph Kabila.
The first flight left on Friday morning bound for the eastern town of Goma via the country's third city of Kisangani.
The second departed three minutes later for southeastern Lubumbashi, the country's second city.
